docs.abstract: Thomas L Friedman Op-Ed column expresses concern about statements made by Republican elected officials concerning abortion, which illustrate way in which ever-more-assertive far-right base is intent on pushing party to uncompromising position on issue; contends that their characterization of themselves as being pro-life distorts the issue, and underlines hypocrisy of description being applied to party that adamantly opposes gun control.
docs.lead_paragraph: If you respect the sanctity of life, then it shouldn’t be limited solely to the issue of abortion.
docs.snippet: If you respect the sanctity of life, then it shouldn’t be limited solely to the issue of abortion.

headline.seo: U.S. Cuts Estimate of Sugar Intake of Typical American
headline.main: U.S. Cuts Estimate of Sugar Intake

docs.abstract: Agriculture Department lowers its estimate of annual sugar consumption in United States to 76.7 pounds a person from nearly 100 pounds; decision raises questions about entire notion of per-capita consumption just as battles over sugar and sweeteners reach peak.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Agriculture Department has lowered its estimate of annual sugar consumption to around 80 pounds a person from nearly 100 pounds, reshaping the debate over sweeteners.
docs.snippet: The Agriculture Department has lowered its estimate of annual sugar consumption to around 80 pounds a person from nearly 100 pounds, reshaping the debate over sweeteners.

headline.main: The Family Doctor, Minus the M.D.

docs.abstract: America has a serious shortage of primary care physicians. But Family Health Clinic in Delphi, Ind., is a model of how nurses can help fill the gap.
docs.snippet: America has a serious shortage of primary care physicians. But Family Health Clinic in Delphi, Ind., is a model of how nurses can help fill the gap.

headline.seo: 6 Seek City Council Seat Vacated by Seabrook in the Bronx
headline.print_headline: 6 Are Seeking Council Seat One Man Held for a Decade
headline.main: 6 Are Seeking Council Seat One Man Held for a Decade

docs.abstract: Six candidates are vying to fill Bronx Councilman Larry Seabrook's seat in Nov 6 special election; Seabrook was removed from office after being convicted of fraud in July 2012.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Bronx candidates include a union organizer, a criminal defense lawyer, a bus company owner, an economic-policy adviser, an Anglican minister and a community center director.
docs.snippet: The Bronx candidates include a union organizer, a criminal defense lawyer, a bus company owner, an economic-policy adviser, an Anglican minister and a community center director.

headline.print_headline: In Fighting Obesity, Drink Sizes Matter
headline.main: In Fight Against Obesity, Drink Sizes Matter

docs.abstract: History has shown that teaching people what is good for them is not enough. It must be accompanied by restrictions that curb unhealthy habits.
docs.snippet: History has shown that teaching people what is good for them is not enough. It must be accompanied by restrictions that curb unhealthy habits.

headline.seo: Eating Well Magazine’s New Lease on Life
headline.print_headline: A Sale Gives a Magazine on Healthy Eating a New Lease on Life
headline.main: A Sale Gives a Magazine on Healthy Eating a New Lease on Life

docs.abstract: Eating Well magazine, reinvigorated after $29 million buyout from Meredith Corp, is attempting to forge a path to success in troubled food magazine industry following closure of Gourmet magazine; company, which caters to healthy eaters, has eschewed promoting rich comfort foods that many other publications have focused on during the recession.
docs.lead_paragraph: Eating Well is trying to forge its path in a world without Gourmet magazine, while avoiding high-calorie comfort food that became a popular topic during the recession.
docs.snippet: Eating Well is trying to forge its path in a world without Gourmet magazine, while avoiding high-calorie comfort food that became a popular topic during the recession.
